channel.title: Configuration on zrepl - ZFS replication
channel.description: Recent content in Configuration on zrepl - ZFS replication

item.title: Mapping & Filter Syntax
item.description: Under Construction Mapping & Filter Syntax For various job types, a filesystem mapping or filter needs to be specified. Both have in common that they return a result for a given filesystem path (in the ZFS filesystem hierarchy): mappings return a target filesystem, filters return a filter result (omit, ok). The pattern syntax is the same for mappings and filters and is documented in the following section. Pattern Syntax A mapping / filter is specified as a YAML dictionary with patterns as keys and results as values.

item.title: Transports
item.description: Under Construction Stdinserver The SSH transport connects to the remote server using the SSH binary in $PATH and the parameters specified in the zrepl config file. However, instead of a traditional interactive SSH session, zrepl expects another instance of zrepl on the other side of the connection; You may be familiar with this concept from git shell or Borg Backup. Check the examples for instructions on how to set this up on your machines!
